p: Increased exposure to PM 2.5 and O 3 increases risk of premature mortality, which we quantify using BenMAP. Health impact functions are based on EPA-selected epidemiological studies and expert elicitation used in the US EPA 2012 Regulatory Impact Analysis for revisions to the NAAQS for particulate matter. Tables 2 and 3 summarize the changes to premature mortality from increased July exposure to PM 2.5 and O 3 under each scenario (negative numbers indicate adverse health outcomes and monetary costs). Morbidity impacts are summarized in S2â€“ S4 Tables.
